page.title: 18COLTON, STAFFORDSHIRE
page.content: Colton is surrounded by farmland, most of which is under grass for cattle and sheep, a small proportion is used for growing cereals. There are no factories in Colton, most people work in Rugeley 2 miles away and beyond. Most people from Colton travel by private means because there is only one service bus. The daily service leaves Colton for Rugeley at 9.00 am and returns at noon. The nearest railway station is Rugeley Trent Valley station and is about 1 mile away - about half way to Rugeley. The local trains go between Stafford and Rugby. In Colton there is a primary school for about 40 children. Two school buses take older children to the secondary schools in Rugeley. The village church has 2 rectories, one for the vicar (at present unoccupied), the other is a private house.
